alert.note: Alert for Big Island South; Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Kohala; Kona; Lanai Leeward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 22 at 3:36PM HST until January 24 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND WEST FACING SHORES OF LANAI AND THE BIG ISLAND... .A large west-northwest (280-310 degrees) continues to decline, briefly below High Surf Advisory criteria tonight, then trend back up tonight through Tuesday as a similar west- northwest swell arrives. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Surf of 15 to 20 feet along north facing shores of Niihau and Kauai. Surf of 14 to 18 feet along north facing shores of Oahu. Surf of 10 to 15 feet along north facing shores of Molokai, Maui, and west facing shores of Oahu. Surf of 8 to 12 feet along west facing shores of Molokai and 7 to 10 feet along west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, north facing shores of Maui, and west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
